intro: Spermacoce aculeata, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically arranged in cymes, and it is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its fruits are dry, capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Spermacoce aculeata is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant in some regions.
